answerText: sorting[10] In this probabilistic sorting algorithm of average time complexity n log n, a random pivot is chosen, all elements smaller than the pivot are moved to one side, and the algorithm is called recursively on the right and left lists.
heading: ACF Regionals |2015 | Dartmouth A | 13 | Science | Computer Science | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Comparison-based algorithms for accomplishing this task include a divide-and-conquer algorithm that breaks down elements into small sublists that are later merged. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this common task in computer science, the rearrangement of items in a list into a defined order.
